LanguageData.Silver.label: silver
LanguageData.Silver.description: This metal is mostly used as a commodity currency. It can also be used for making decorations.
LanguageData.Gold.label: gold
LanguageData.Gold.description: The most seductive metal of them all. While it is too soft to be of much practical use, it is strikingly beautiful and never tarnishes. Millions have died in attempting to feed the endless human thirst for gold.
LanguageData.Steel.label: steel
LanguageData.Steel.description: An iron-carbon metal alloy used for building a huge variety of structures, weapons, and machines.
LanguageData.Plasteel.label: plasteel
LanguageData.Plasteel.description: Advanced spacer tech structural material. Plasteel is extremely strong due to its unique molecular structure.
LanguageData.WoodLog.label: wood
LanguageData.WoodLog.description: Wood from trees or other fibrous plants. Useful for building structures and weapons. It is a good fuel for campfires and generators, and can be refined into chemfuel. In a pinch, a piece of wood can be used as a weapon or a leg.
LanguageData.WoodLog.tools.0.label: log
LanguageData.Uranium.label: uranium
LanguageData.Uranium.description: An dark, heavy metal. While it is best known as a fuel for nuclear devices, its extreme density and hardness also make it good for making certain primitive weapons and armor.
LanguageData.Jade.label: jade
LanguageData.Jade.description: A hard, green stone. Because of its beauty and rarity, jade is often used for ornaments and decorations. Its hardness and density also makes it a good material for blunt weapons.
LanguageData.Cloth.label: cloth
LanguageData.Synthread.label: synthread
LanguageData.Synthread.description: Spacer-tech synthetic fabric designed for making ordinary clothes. It is soft, light, strong, and insulates well.
LanguageData.DevilstrandCloth.label: devilstrand
LanguageData.DevilstrandCloth.description: Fabric spun from microfibers extracted from devilstrand mushrooms. It is very tough, good at insulating, and protects well against flame.
LanguageData.Hyperweave.label: hyperweave
LanguageData.Hyperweave.description: Nano-fibers woven into sheets molecule-by-molecule using specialized production mechanites. While it flexes freely most of the time, it stiffens to absorb blows as they land, and is incredibly difficult to break. The secrets of its production are known only to the most advanced glitterworld cultures.
LanguageData.WoolMegasloth.label: megasloth wool
LanguageData.WoolMegasloth.description: While somewhat coarse, megasloth wool's long fibers make it very strong. It is exceptionally warm.
LanguageData.WoolMuffalo.label: muffalo wool
LanguageData.WoolMuffalo.description: Soft, light and provides very good insulation. Muffalo wool clothes can keep the body warm even in very cold conditions.
LanguageData.WoolCamel.label: camelhair
LanguageData.WoolCamel.description: Camelhair clothing is usually worn by desert travelers to protect them from the heat. It provides excellent heat insulation due to its thermostatic properties.
LanguageData.WoolAlpaca.label: alpaca wool
LanguageData.WoolAlpaca.description: The remarkably soft wool of an alpaca. It is very warm.
